Package planeair.graph.coloring

Class ColoringUtilities

java.lang.Object
planeair.graph.coloring.ColoringUtilities
public abstract class ColoringUtilities extends Object
Class handling Coloring algorithms, mostly consists of static methods

  • Method Details

    • computeNumberOfConflicts

      public static int computeNumberOfConflicts(GraphSAE graph)
      Checks if the coloring worked.
      Parameters:
      graph - Graph that will be tested.
      Returns:
      int number of nodes which are adjacent to another node with the same color.

    • setGraphStyle

      public static void setGraphStyle(GraphSAE graph, int nbColor)
      Reads the color attribute of the nodes to give them an actual color on the display by editing its stylesheet
      Parameters:
      graph - graph getting colored
      nbColor - number of colors the graph has, if 0 or less, initializes a default style coloring

    • toValidHex

      public static String toValidHex(String str)
      Fills the leading digits of a hex code with 0 until the number has 6 digits example : str FF (reprensenting #FF) becomes 0000FF
      Parameters:
      str - hex value of a number, HAS TO ONLY CONTAIN NUMBERS
      Returns:
      the formatted hex string

    • removeCurrentColoring

      public static void removeCurrentColoring(GraphSAE graph)
      Removes all attributes linked to the coloring of this graph
      Parameters:
      graph - The graph in question

    • getLeastConflictingColor

      public static int[] getLeastConflictingColor(org.graphstream.graph.Node node, int kMax)
      Colors a node by minimizing conflicts
      Parameters:
      node - node you are trying to color
      kMax - the kMax of the graph the node originates from
      Returns:
      array consisting of 2 values, the color assigned to the node and the number of conflicts it generated

    • colorWithLeastConflicts

      public static int colorWithLeastConflicts(Set<org.graphstream.graph.Node> graphSet, int kMax)
      Colors all Nodes that don't yet have a color with the least conflicting color.

      A conflict is an edge whose extremeties have the same color
      Parameters:
      graphSet - Set containing Nodes we are trying to color. If one of the nodes has a color, it gets skipped
      kMax - Maximum color that can be assigned to a node
      Returns:
      The number of conflicts that occurred

    • colorWithLeastConflicts

      public static int colorWithLeastConflicts(GraphSAE graph)
      Colors all Nodes that don't yet have a color with the least conflicting color a conflict is an edge whose extremeties have the same color
      Parameters:
      graph - the graph from which all the nodes will be taken calls the default implementation of this method (the one with a set) with the graph's kmax and all its nodes that don't yet have a color
      Returns:
      The number of conflicts that occurred

    • colorGraphWithChosenAlgorithm

      public static boolean colorGraphWithChosenAlgorithm(GraphSAE graph, ColoringAlgorithms algorithm)
      Colors the graph with the chosen algorithm if the algorithm has a defined method for it.

      Its arguments should be a GraphSAE and it should be static
      Parameters:
      graph - The graph we want to color
      algorithm - The algorithm used
      Returns:
      true if the method was successfully invoked, false else
